required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Food on the Pharmacokinetics of NNC0123-0000-0338 in a Tablet Formulation in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Food on the Pharmacokinetics of NNC0123-0000-0338 in a Tablet Formulation in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of the trial is to investigate the effect of food on the pharmacokinetics (the exposure of the trial drug in the body) of NNC0123-0000-0338 in a tablet formulation in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum insulin 338 concentration-time curve
primary_outcome.time_frame: From a 0-288 hours NNC0123-0000-0338 serum concentration-time-curve based on 41 sampling time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum insulin 338 concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 288 hours after a single dose (SD)
From 0 to 288 hours after a single dose (SD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma capric acid concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 24 hours after a single dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed plasma capric acid concentration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 24 hours after a single dose

intervention.description: Each subject will be randomly allocated to a fixed treatment sequence of four single-dose administrations of oral insulin 338 in a GIPETÂ® I tablet, administered on four separate dosing visits. The subjects will be dosed in the morning in the fasting state prior to four different post-dose fasting periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-64 years (both inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent
- Body mass index 18.5-28.0 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)
- Subject who is considered to be healthy based on the medical history, physical examination, and the results of vital signs, electrocardiogram and clinical laboratory tests performed during the screening visit, as judged by the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to trial products or related products
- Previous participation in this trial. Participation is defined as informed consent
- Presence of clinically significant acute and chronic gastrointestinal symptoms (e.g. nausea, vomiting, heartburn or diarrhoea) within 2 weeks prior to first dosing, as judged by the investigator
